abstract_summ: On March 16 2020, French authorities ordered a large scale lockdown to counter the COVID-19 epidemic wave rising in the country, stopping non-essential economic, educational, and entertainment activities . One month later, the number of new hospitalizations and ICU admissions had reached a plateau and were beginning a slow descent . If no control measures had been set up, between March 19 and April 19 2020, almost 23% of the French population would have been affected by the epidemic .
